result.execSummary:
The defendant Angelo D Orlando was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 08/21/2015 @ 1:30pm, Br-40

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the DOC's. Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable. Court waived the DNA surcharge as no DNA sample was taken. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
- No firearms/weapons. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

- Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete treatment (in-patient if possible) including random screens.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- No Contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to No Violent Contact.
- Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children as approved by agent and any other court orders.
- Defendant must be sober.
- Pay all supervision fees as determined by the DOC's.
- Maintain employment.

timeConds.notes:
09-25-15/ Rebecca F Dallet
Defendant is non-complaint with Probation conditions.
The Court ordered the defendant be taken into custody to spend 45 days, Straight Time, with NO Good Time credit, as condition time in the HOC

STAYED pending a review on 08-21-15

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angelo D Orlando

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Reflects 09-25-15 Court order imposing 45 days of condition time

Defendant Angelo D Orlando not in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Per email from Probation Dept., defendant is currently in absconder status.  Court ordered defendant to serve 45 days of the condition time; straight time.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.
At the request of the agent, the 8/21/15 probation review is rescheduled to 9/25/15 at 1:30 pm.   rmm
Original CHANGE OF PLEA ADJOURNED Transcript (10 pages) commencing JUNE 8, 2015, received and filed.  jm

Defendant Angelo D Orlando in court with attorney Michael s Winter.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charges dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNT 3:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights  Reported to Motor Vehicle Department/jg and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  
*
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Tiffany P.  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 45 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 8/21/15.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete treatment (in-patient if possible) including random screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children as approved by agent and any other court orders.  Defendant must be sober.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Court waived the DNA surcharge as no DNA sample was taken.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Angelo D Orlando in court with attorney Michael s Winter.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for plea and sentencing.  Court attempted to take a plea but the defendant was falling asleep.  Court ordered matter adjourned and advised the defendant to get sleep next time.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
FILED, RECALLED SUBPOENA (served and signed on 05-09-2015)

Defendant Angelo D Orlando in court with attorney Michael S Winter.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for final pre-trial. For reasons stated on the record, Court granted State's motion to adjourn the 05/20/2015 jury trial date.   Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Angelo D Orlando in court with attorney Michael s Winter.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
